newsitem.title: PERU: Peru first Latam nation to outlaw human cloning.
newsitem.headline: Peru first Latam nation to outlaw human cloning.

text.p: Peru has become the first Latin American nation to ban human cloning in a new health law passed by Congress, legislators said on Friday.
"Cloning of human beings goes against people's individuality. The (law's) aim is to avoid creating unnatural procreation," said Miguel Velit, president of Congress' health committee.
Congress included the ban in a new General Health Law passed late on Thursday after Peruvians were shocked by reports that experiments abroad had indicated human cloning might be possible.

The possibility of cloning humans moved closer to reality this year when geneticists in Scotland used a frozen cell from an adult sheep to create another virtually identical adult which they named Dolly.
